metadata.name: A Devotee with Fire Pots
metadata.description:
Sri Mutharmman temple is located at Kulasekharapattinam village near Tiruchendur 55 km south of Tuticorin, Tamilnadu, India. In this temple, Dasara is celebrated as a big festival. Lakhs of people are assembled here to celebrate this festival. The uniqueness and oddity of the festival are that the devotees need not spend from their pocket.  On the last day, the seashores of this otherwise deserted coastal village turn into a veritable carnival of folk music and folk dance of the devotees in their chosen fancy dresses to either solicit the grace of or to thank for the boon granted by presiding deity Sri Muthramman considered to be the incarnation of Sakthi the consort of Lord Shiva in Hinduism.

I visited this place in 2019 to photo document the events and their culture.

Artist: Mahesh Balasubramanian  
Edition: 1/1  
Date: 08/10/2019  
Location: Kulasekarapattinam, Tamilnadu, India

Artist Bio:

Mahesh is an Independent Photographer from Chennai, India. His works are published in various international magazines like National Geographic Traveler US, BLUR, Digital Photo UK, Wanderlust UK, Dodho, etc. He has won many international awards like National Geography Traveler Photo Contest, 1x, PX3, IPA, Siena Photo Awards, Monovision, Shoottheface, etc. Adobe has also chosen one of his photos for Adobe Lightroom as a Splash Screen (startup screen).

Twitter: https://twitter.com/maheshguild

https://www.maheshb.com
